description: Single storey side to front extension incorporating front porch; single storey side to rear extension; rooflights in side roof slope; external alterations; installation of two 1.5m high brick piers, 1.5m high brick wall with railing top and two 1.5m high electric vehicle access gates to front boundary; hard and soft landscaping to front (demolition of attached garage and side extension)
decision_conditions: <p>The proposed front extension, with particular reference to its excessive mass, width and insurbordinate roof form is considered an incongruous, bulky and unbalanced design that fails to integrate with the host property,&nbsp; its semi-detached partner and would constitute&nbsp; overdevelopment of the site. This is considered contrary to the high-quality design aspirations of the National Planning Policy Framework (2021), Policy D3 Policy of the London Plan (2021); CS.1 of the Harrow Core Strategy (2012), Policy DM1 of the Development Management Plan Local Policies (2013) and the adopted Supplementary Planning Document: Residential Design Guide (2010).<br></p>

<p class="MsoNormal">The
proposed rear extension, with particular reference to its substantial depth,
orientation towards the neighbouring property and immediate proximity to their
shared boundary, creates an unacceptable sense of enclosure, unduly restricts
daylight/sunlight and impacts the outlook of neighbouring ground floor windows
and garden area of 120 Rowlands Avenue, contrary to the Policy DM1 of Harrow’s
Development Management Policies Local Plan document (2013) and Harrow’s
Residential Design Guide SPD (2010).<font face="Arial, sans-serif"><span style="font-size: 11pt;"><o:p></o:p></span></font></p>
